com.google.appinventor.components.runtime

Class Slider

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.google.appinventor.components.runtime.VisibleComponent
      • com.google.appinventor.components.runtime.AndroidViewComponent
        • com.google.appinventor.components.runtime.Slider
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Component

    public class Slider
extends AndroidViewComponent
    This class is used to display a Slider.

    The Slider is a progress bar that adds a draggable thumb. You can touch the thumb and drag left or right to set the slider thumb position. As Slider thumb is dragged, it will trigger PositionChanged event, reporting the position of the Slider thumb. The Slider uses the following default values. However these values can be changed through designer or block editor

    • MinValue
    • MaxValue
    • ThumbPosition

    Author:
    kashi01@gmail.com (M. Hossein Amerkashi), hal@mit.edu (Hal Abelson)

      • setSeekbarPosition

        private void setSeekbarPosition()
        Given min, max, thumb position, this method determines where the thumb position would be within normal SeekBar 0-100 range
        Parameters:
        min - value for slider
        max - value for slider
        thumb - the slider thumb position

      • ThumbPosition

        public void ThumbPosition(float position)
        Sets the slider thumb position.
        Parameters:
        position - the position of the slider thumb. This value should be between sliderMinValue and sliderMaxValue. If this value is not within the min and max, then it will be calculated.

      • ColorLeft

        public int ColorLeft()
        Returns the color of the slider bar to the left of the thumb, as an alpha-red-green-blue integer, i.e., 0xAARRGGBB. An alpha of 00 indicates fully transparent and FF means opaque.
        Returns:
        left color in the format 0xAARRGGBB, which includes alpha, red, green, and blue components

      • ColorLeft

        public void ColorLeft(int argb)
        Specifies the color of the slider bar to the left of the thumb as an alpha-red-green-blue integer, i.e., 0xAARRGGBB. An alpha of 00 indicates fully transparent and FF means opaque.
        Parameters:
        argb - background color in the format 0xAARRGGBB, which includes alpha, red, green, and blue components

      • ColorRight

        public int ColorRight()
        Returns the color of the slider bar to the right of the thumb, as an alpha-red-green-blue integer, i.e., 0xAARRGGBB. An alpha of 00 indicates fully transparent and FF means opaque.
        Returns:
        right color in the format 0xAARRGGBB, which includes alpha, red, green, and blue components
